tweets.text:
European eels return to the Beaulieu Estate's Hartford Stream, New Forest, thanks to @HeritageFundUK and @EnvAgencySE for providing essential funds through the @NewForestNPA Our Past Our Future Living Waters project. 

Read on: https://t.co/dyvahklYet

tweets.text:
Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

There are approximately 240,600km of rivers and streams in England.

Read our blog on the work we do to deliver the protection and enhancement they need üëá

https://t.co/QLZ8HSZI35

Looking at the replies to this it appears the truth is now out there.

The @EnvAgency are a ‚ÄúFailed and discredited organisation‚Äù. https://t.co/B2JJlcQ0hj
@recylebin_ @aesanjay @SustainSMC @EnvAgency @rplast @recycleye @recycle_now @WasteManagement @WasterInc @wasterecycling @garbage @WBAtcdk ???

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.

New @EnvAgency figures reveal today that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are now classed in good health. Urgent investment is needed to turn our suffering #waters into thriving blue corridors that are good for wildlife, people and business  https://t.co/dFukRDRkV0 https://t.co/B9VTpFb0cv

tweets.text: @EnvAgency This is the biggest load of cobblers you have ever come up with.  The EA has presided over the greatest decline in the quality of rivers for a century.  You should be ashamed of yourselves

Have you seen the latest plans for the #Preston and South #Ribble #Flood Risk Management Scheme? You can check them out and give feedback on our new online engagement platform: https://t.co/fS0u63mpyK https://t.co/3yAVpoNhxL

To celebrate #WorldRiversDay #TeamEA are highlighting our work in partnership with @EdenRiversTrust & @networkrail in Thrimby An 800m channel realignment project that will not only provide benefits to fish and other wildlife but also reduce flood risk to the West Coast Main Line. https://t.co/FwwebMtf9o

@EnvAgency #WorldRiversDay extraordinary to claim the rivers are improving & polluters are prosecuted under your management @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd this is the true picture of the state of the rivers 2018 Gaywood river tributary once a lovely Chalkstream üí©üíÄüêüüò± https://t.co/jIsanf5EbA

#JRHartley author Michael Russell 1933 2020 RIP remember the #yellowpages ad died April Shocking betrayal of the River Babingley his favourite Chalk Stream idiot trying to drain its floodplain @amwellmagna @NrtSam @stuartpengs @river_usk @theriverstrust @WetlandsInt @The_RRC https://t.co/UbnQmX3EAX

Well, I know it's only a small thing, but the fact we got through #WorldRiversDay without our regulator, and the organisation tasked with protecting them, @NatResWales mentioning it once, tells its own story. I shouldn't allow myself to be so easily disappointed ...

@EnvAgency Enforcing regulations would be a good start. Perhaps then we'd have a few rivers that would pass water quality standards? The solution is EA regulation, not everyone doing their bit - a diversionary fallacy.  Those who care about rivers are already 'working together' to help.

@EnvAgency You have systematically eroded the legal protection of our rivers in the last 20 years with obvious results. We don't want you to have anything to do with World Rivers Day, it is for people who respect and love rivers. Go away.
Well not a big song and dance, but a celebration none the less of rivers, their inhabitants, and just being outside with family enjoying nature happy #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/coCRZRwwQU

The citizens of kayes don't worry about the garbage it will be collected. #GIE #WALKITARE is here to free you from the #GARBAGES.‚ôªÔ∏èüöØ‚ôªÔ∏èüöØ‚ôªÔ∏èüöØ @aesanjay @SustainSMC @EnvAgency @rplast @recycleye @recycle_now @WasteManagement @WasterInc @wasterecycling @garbage @WBAtcdk @recylebin_

I thank you.

https://t.co/ug39zdi4nb

@RussellB1ggs @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd And just look at the Eign brook a forgotten tributary of the Wye running through Hereford city. It's a disgrace for one of England's greatest salmon rivers.
#sosriverwye #savethewye #3wyeswomen https://t.co/MkdydQ5HlT
